Html:
I love this as an alternative to PaperCut (http://invalidlogic.com/papercut/) and hope that it's more actively developed. I was just wondering whether it would be possible to add a TEXT (alternative part) view to the program as this is really hard to get to with Outlook and the other default viewers (without viewing the source that is).

Keep up the good work.

Thanks

Tim

Hi Tim

I have checked in a "View source" option to SVN which will open the source of the entire message in whatever application is associated with ".txt" files. Whilst this isn't quite what you mentioned (viewing only one of the MIME parts), hopefully this should be enough for you?

I will provide a new release shortly.

Thanks

Rob

Thanks Rob, if I get time I'll have a poke around the source and add it if you like :)

Tim
This is in release 1.0.1 which is now available for download

Hi Rob,

Just a quick one to thank you for putting the button in there however it's not "quite" right, see the standard plain text email that I used for testing:

-----------------------

Received: from jupiter (jupiter [127.0.0.1])
     by localhost (Eric Daugherty's C# Email Server)
     01/07/2009 12:38:11
MIME-Version: 1.0
From: "Test" <test@test.com>
To: test@test.com
Date: 1 Jul 2009 12:38:11 +0100
Subject: Changes to backorder for account #1
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tim Gaunt from TestAccount (1) has changed the =0D=0Adetails of=
 one or more items on backorder.=0D=0A        =0D=0ADetails of the changes=
 are below:=0D=0AOrder Id           Line Number        Previous Qty    =
   New Qty381862              3                   10                  336=
 (+326)=0D=0A=0D=0A=0D=0ARegards,=0D=0A=0D=0AThe Robot

-----------------------

That should read:

-----------------------

Tim Gaunt from TestAccount (1) has changed the
details of one or more items on backorder.

Details of the changes are below:
Order Id           Line Number        Previous Qty       New Qty
381862             3                         10                      336 (+326)

Regards,

The Robot

-----------------------

Tim

Hi Tim

Thanks for your feedback.

The strange =0D characters you can see are down to the "quoted-printable" encoding your message is using. As you are viewing the source of the message this is correct that you should see these. I am planning to offer a "message inspector" view to the next release which will be able to display each (MIME) part of the message and display it as you would expect with the encoding decoded.

Thanks
Rob

Hi Rob,

Just read your forum post about what you've got planned for v2 -looks fab, look forward to it!

Tim
